title: New report highlights how Liverpool City Region can boost economy and reach Net Zero by driving climate technology - Growth Platform
summary: The Liverpool City Region aims to become a climate tech cluster by leveraging unique assets and focusing on electrification of transport, marine and maritime, sustainable chemicals, and manufacturing innovation to reach net zero by 2040.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article discusses the development of a climate tech cluster focusing on innovation towards environmental sustainability goals like decarbonization and reducing negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article outlines the shift towards climate tech innovation as a new approach within the region's business ecosystem, showcasing a new direction and strategy for economic growth.
green_product: TRUE. The focus on developing green technologies in areas such as electrification of transport, sustainable chemicals, and manufacturing innovations aligns with the definition of green products that significantly reduce environmental impact.
green_process: TRUE. The emphasis on promoting sustainability, reducing waste, conserving natural resources, and limiting harmful substances in manufacturing and production activities aligns with the concept of green processes.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 926130 - Regulation and Administration of Communications, Electric, Gas, and Other Utilities, 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services, 541710 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences, 541715 - Research and Development in the Social Sciences and Humanities
greenwashing: FALSE. The article focuses on genuine efforts to develop a climate tech cluster and enhance sustainability goals rather than misrepresenting environmental benefits.
